GPyOpt.optimization package¶

Submodules¶

GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer module¶

class GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.AcquOptimizer(space)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for the optimizers of the acquisition functions.

Parameters:space – design space class from GPyOpt.
optimize(f=None, df=None, f_df=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • f – function to optimize.
  • df – gradient of the function to optimize.
  • f_df – returns both the function to optimize and its gradient.
GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.AcquisitionOptimizer(space, optimizer='lbfgs', current_X=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Chooser for the type of acquisition optimizer to use. The decision is based on the type of input space and whether it contains discrete, continuous, bandit variables or a mix of them. If the problem is defined for a mix of discrete and continuous variables the optimization is done as follows:

  • All possible combinations of the values of the discrete variables are computed.
  • For each combination the problem is solved for the remaining continuous variables.
  • The arg min of all the sub-problems is taken.

Note that this may be slow in cases with many discrete variables. In the bandits settings not optimization is carried out. Since the space is finite the argmin is computed.

Parameters:
  • space – design space class from GPyOpt.
  • optimizer – optimizer to use. Can be selected among: - ‘lbfgs’: L-BFGS. - ‘DIRECT’: Dividing Rectangles. - ‘CMA’: covariance matrix adaptation.
class GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.BanditAcqOptimizer(space, current_X, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.AcquOptimizer

General class for acquisition optimizers defined on bandits

Parameters:
  • space – design space class from GPyOpt.
  • current_X – numpy array containing the arms of the bandit that hasn’t been pulled yet.
optimize(f=None, df=None, f_df=None)[source]¶

Optimization of the acquisition. Since it is a bandit it just takes the argmin of the outputs.

Parameters:
  • f – function to optimize.
  • df – gradient of the function to optimize.
  • f_df – returns both the function to optimize and its gradient.
class GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.ContAcqOptimizer(space, optimizer='lbfgs', n_samples=5000, fast=True, random=True, search=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.AcquOptimizer

General class for acquisition optimizers defined in continuous domains

Parameters:
  • space – design space class from GPyOpt.
  • optimizer – optimizer to use. Can be selected among: - ‘lbfgs’: L-BFGS. - ‘DIRECT’: Dividing Rectangles. - ‘CMA’: covariance matrix adaptation.
  • n_samples – number of initial points in which the acquisition is evaluated.
  • fast – whether just a local optimizer should be run starting in the best location (default, True). If False a local search is performed for each point and the best of all is taken.
  • ramdom – whether the initial samples are taken randomly (or in a grid if False). Note that, if False, n_samples represent the number of points user per dimension.
  • search – whether to do local search or not.
fix_dimensions(dims=None, values=None)[source]¶

Fix the values of some of the dimensions. Once this this done the optimization is carried out only across the not fixed dimensions.

Parameters:
  • dims – list of the indexes of the dimensions to fix.
  • values – list of the values at which the selected dimensions should be fixed.
optimize(f=None, df=None, f_df=None)[source]¶

Optimizes the input function.

Parameters:
  • f – function to optimize.
  • df – gradient of the function to optimize.
  • f_df – returns both the function to optimize and its gradient.
class GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.MixedAcqOptimizer(space, optimizer='lbfgs', n_samples=1000, fast=True, random=True, search=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.acquisition_optimizer.AcquOptimizer

General class for acquisition optimizers defined on mixed domains of continuous and discrete variables.

Parameters:
  • space – design space class from GPyOpt.
  • optimizer – optimizer to use. Can be selected among: - ‘lbfgs’: L-BFGS. - ‘DIRECT’: Dividing Rectangles. - ‘CMA’: covariance matrix adaptation.
  • n_samples – number of initial points in which the acquisition is evaluated.
  • fast – whether just a local optimizer should be run starting in the best location (default, True). If False a local search is performed for each point and the best of all is taken.
  • ramdom – whether the initial samples are taken randomly (or in a grid if False). Note that, if False, n_samples represent the number of points user per dimension.
  • search – whether to do local search or not.
optimize(f=None, df=None, f_df=None)[source]¶

Optimization of the acquisition.

Parameters:
  • f – function to optimize.
  • df – gradient of the function to optimize.
  • f_df – returns both the function to optimize and its gradient.

GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer module¶

class GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Opt_CMA(space, maxiter=1000)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Optimizer

Wrapper the Covariance Matrix Adaptation Evolutionary strategy (CMA-ES) optimization method. It works generating an stochastic search based on multivariate Gaussian samples. Only requires f and the box constrains to work.

class GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Opt_DIRECT(space, maxiter=1000)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Optimizer

Wrapper for DIRECT optimization method. It works partitioning iteratively the domain of the function. Only requires f and the box constrains to work.

optimize(x0=None, f=None, df=None, f_df=None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • x0 – initial point for a local optimizer.
  • f – function to optimize.
  • df – gradient of the function to optimize.
  • f_df – returns both the function to optimize and its gradient.
class GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Opt_lbfgs(space, maxiter=1000)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.optimization.optimizer.Optimizer

Wrapper for l-bfgs-b to use the true or the approximate gradients.
